head.title: kcgi | minimal CGI library for C

body.header:
kcgi — minimal CGI library for C
version @VERSION@ Sources Archives

article.p: kcgi is a minimal CGI library for web applications (HTML and HTTP) in ISO C. It was designed to be simple, ISC licensed, and auditable. See a Comparison of CGI Libraries in C for alternatives. To start, download kcgi.tgz and run make install into your PREFIX of choice (you may want to comment out HAVE_ZLIB if your system does not support zlib compression). The kcgi(3) manpage documents all function, variables, types, standards, and general usage. kcgi is a BSD.lv project.
The following is a rough feature list of kcgi. See the manual for details.

ul.li: query string, cookie, and form (multipart form-data and mixed, urlencoded, and plain) input
lightweight functions for building HTML5 trees and HTTP headers
safe memory allocation functions (inspired by OpenSSH)

article.p: Most kcgi applications work as follows (the sample.c file distributed in the source consists of a full working example):

ol.li: Call khttp_parse as early as possible. This will parse input fields and set up the HTTP environment. At present, kcgi parses (and optionally validates) cookies; query string GET data; and the urlencoded, form-data, and plain POST data. It also maps page and MIME requests.

Process input fields by examining the struct kpair elements of the main struct kreq structure. This main structure contains all parsed input fields and environment information (in the interests of simplicity, kcgi uses a single structure instead of accessor functions).
Emit HTTP headers with khttp_head, followed by khttp_body to begin the HTTP body. The latter will automatically trigger compression, if requested by the client.
Emit HTTP body output using HTML5 tree-building functions khtml_attr, khtml_close, khtml_closeto, khtml_decl, khtml_elem, khtml_elemat, khtml_entity, khtml_input, khtml_ncr, and khtml_text; and/or
use the khtml_template function to populate file templates with a mixture of HTML-building functions; and/or
use khttp_putc and khttp_puts for non-HTML media.
Call khttp_free to close the HTTP document and free all memory.

article.p: This library is still quite new. Contact Kristaps with questions or comments.

Add kutil_urlencode and kutil_urlpart for standards-compliant formatting of URLs. Add khtml_int64 as a convenience function. Fix khtml_text to properly escape ampersands. Fix khtml_attr to properly HTML-escape attribute values. Removed khtml_input, which wasn't specific enough to actually be useful (e.g., implementing HTML5 range inputs and other goodies) while complicating things enough to be ugly (i.e., kfield).
